titles.title: Disapproving the extension of nondiscriminatory treatment (most-favored-nation treatment) to the products of the People's Republic of China.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported Adversely by the Yeas and Nays: 31 - 6.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Unfavorable Executive Comment Received from State.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported adversely by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 103-575.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 320.

action.text: Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 509 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 373 and H.R. 4590 with 1 hour and 20 minutes of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions. Waiving all points of order against consideration of the joints resolution and against its consideration in the House. After disposition of the joint resolution, it shall be in order to consider H.R. 4590 in the Committee of the Whole, with up to one hour of general debate. Specified amendments are in order. No amendment to H.R. 4590 shall be in order except those amendments printed in part 2 of the report accompanying this resolution, if offered in the order and manner specified. If more than one of the amendments in the report is adopted, only the last such amendment shall be considered as finally adopted and reported to the House. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on H.R. 4590 and any amendment thereto without intervening mo...
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 509.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 373 and H.R. 4590 with 1 hour and 20 minutes of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions. All points of order against consideration of the joint resolution and against its consideration in the House are waived. After disposition of the joint resolution, it shall be in order to consider H.R. 4590 in the Committee of the Whole, with up to one hour of general debate. Specified amendments are in order. No amendment to H.R. 4590 shall be in order except those amendments printed in part 2 of the report accompanying this resolution, if offered in the order and manner specified. If more than one of the amendments in the report is adopted, only the last such amendment shall be considered as finally adopted and reported to the House. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on H.R. 4590 and any amendment
DEBATE - Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 509, the House proceeded with one hour and twenty minutes of general debate.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule and sections 152 and 153 of the Trade Act of 1974.

vote.text: On passage Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 75 - 356 (Roll no. 381).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/8/1994--Introduced. Disapproves the recommendation of the President to extend nondiscriminatory treatment (most-favored-nation treatment) to the products of China.
